answers.answer: If you have gestational diabetes, it will go away after your baby is born. You can't get rid of it though while you're  pregnant but it is manageable.
What do you mean its manageable?
Just eat right count your carbs.

They may have you check your sugar levels with an Accu-check or something similar depending on how bad your GD is, and you will just have to watch what you eat. If it's bad enough you may require insulin injections. Your doctor will discuss everything with you if it is confirmed that you have GD and will tell you the necessary steps you'll need to take to manage it.

question: So they took blood out for diabetes test and they said it come out in normal , so there taking out more blood . I want to know that if I have diabetes during pregnancy could I get rid off it ?
title: can i ?
